trans-unit.source: To see general limits on Azure VMs, see [Azure subscription and service limits, quotas, and constraints](../articles/azure-subscription-service-limits.md).
trans-unit.target: To see general limits on Azure VMs, see [Azure subscription and service limits, quotas, and constraints](../articles/azure-subscription-service-limits.md).

trans-unit.source: The standard sizes consist of several series: A, D, DS, G, and GS.
trans-unit.target: The standard sizes consist of several series: A, D, DS, G, and GS.

trans-unit.source: Considerations for some of these sizes include:
trans-unit.target: Considerations for some of these sizes include:

trans-unit.source: D-series VMs are designed to run applications that demand higher compute power and temporary disk performance.
trans-unit.target: D-series VMs are designed to run applications that demand higher compute power and temporary disk performance.

trans-unit.source: D-series VMs provide faster processors, a higher memory-to-core ratio, and a solid-state drive (SSD) for the temporary disk.
trans-unit.target: D-series VMs provide faster processors, a higher memory-to-core ratio, and a solid-state drive (SSD) for the temporary disk.

trans-unit.source: For details, see the announcement on the Azure blog, [New D-Series Virtual Machine Sizes](https://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/09/22/new-d-series-virtual-machine-sizes/).
trans-unit.target: For details, see the announcement on the Azure blog, [New D-Series Virtual Machine Sizes](https://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/09/22/new-d-series-virtual-machine-sizes/).

trans-unit.source: Dv2-series, a follow-on to the original D-series, features a more powerful CPU.
trans-unit.target: Dv2-series, a follow-on to the original D-series, features a more powerful CPU.

trans-unit.source: The Dv2-series CPU is about 35% faster than the D-series CPU.
trans-unit.target: The Dv2-series CPU is about 35% faster than the D-series CPU.

trans-unit.source: It is based on the latest generation 2.4 GHz Intel Xeon® E5-2673 v3 (Haswell) processor, and with the Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.0, can go up to 3.2 GHz.
trans-unit.target: It is based on the latest generation 2.4 GHz Intel Xeon® E5-2673 v3 (Haswell) processor, and with the Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.0, can go up to 3.2 GHz.

trans-unit.source: The Dv2-series has the same memory and disk configurations as the D-series.
trans-unit.target: The Dv2-series has the same memory and disk configurations as the D-series.

trans-unit.source: G-series VMs offer the most memory and run on hosts that have Intel Xeon E5 V3 family processors.
trans-unit.target: G-series VMs offer the most memory and run on hosts that have Intel Xeon E5 V3 family processors.

trans-unit.source: DS-series, DSv2-series and GS-series VMs can use Premium Storage, which provides high-performance, low-latency storage for I/O intensive workloads.
trans-unit.target: DS-series, DSv2-series and GS-series VMs can use Premium Storage, which provides high-performance, low-latency storage for I/O intensive workloads.

trans-unit.source: These VMs use solid-state drives (SSDs) to host a virtual machine’s disks and also provide a local SSD disk cache.
trans-unit.target: These VMs use solid-state drives (SSDs) to host a virtual machine’s disks and also provide a local SSD disk cache.

trans-unit.source: Premium Storage is available in certain regions.
trans-unit.target: Premium Storage is available in certain regions.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../articles/storage/storage-premium-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../articles/storage/storage-premium-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: The A-series VMs can be deployed on a variety of hardware types and processors.
trans-unit.target: The A-series VMs can be deployed on a variety of hardware types and processors.

trans-unit.source: The size is throttled, based upon the hardware, to offer consistent processor performance for the running instance, regardless of the hardware it is deployed on.
trans-unit.target: The size is throttled, based upon the hardware, to offer consistent processor performance for the running instance, regardless of the hardware it is deployed on.

trans-unit.source: To determine the physical hardware on which this size is deployed, query the virtual hardware from within the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: To determine the physical hardware on which this size is deployed, query the virtual hardware from within the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The A0 size is over-subscribed on the physical hardware.
trans-unit.target: The A0 size is over-subscribed on the physical hardware.

trans-unit.source: For this specific size only, other customer deployments may impact the performance of your running workload.
trans-unit.target: For this specific size only, other customer deployments may impact the performance of your running workload.

trans-unit.source: The relative performance is outlined below as the expected baseline, subject to an approximate variability of 15 percent.
trans-unit.target: The relative performance is outlined below as the expected baseline, subject to an approximate variability of 15 percent.

trans-unit.source: The size of the virtual machine affects the pricing.
trans-unit.target: The size of the virtual machine affects the pricing.

trans-unit.source: The size also affects the processing, memory, and storage capacity of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The size also affects the processing, memory, and storage capacity of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Storage costs are calculated separately based on used pages in the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Storage costs are calculated separately based on used pages in the storage account.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Virtual Machines Pricing Details](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/virtual-machines/) and [Azure Storage Pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/storage/).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Virtual Machines Pricing Details](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/virtual-machines/) and [Azure Storage Pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/storage/).

trans-unit.source: The following considerations might help you decide on a size:
trans-unit.target: The following considerations might help you decide on a size:

trans-unit.source: The A8-A11 sizes are also known as *compute-intensive instances*.
trans-unit.target: The A8-A11 sizes are also known as *compute-intensive instances*.

trans-unit.source: The hardware that runs these sizes is designed and optimized for compute-intensive and network-intensive applications, including high-performance computing (HPC) cluster applications, modeling, and simulations.
trans-unit.target: The hardware that runs these sizes is designed and optimized for compute-intensive and network-intensive applications, including high-performance computing (HPC) cluster applications, modeling, and simulations.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information and considerations about using these sizes, see [About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-a8-a9-a10-a11-specs.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed information and considerations about using these sizes, see [About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-a8-a9-a10-a11-specs.md).

trans-unit.source: Dv2-series, D-series, G-series, and the DS/GS counterparts are ideal for applications that demand faster CPUs, better local disk performance, or have higher memory demands.
trans-unit.target: Dv2-series, D-series, G-series, and the DS/GS counterparts are ideal for applications that demand faster CPUs, better local disk performance, or have higher memory demands.

trans-unit.source: They offer a powerful combination for many enterprise-grade applications.
trans-unit.target: They offer a powerful combination for many enterprise-grade applications.

trans-unit.source: Some of the physical hosts in Azure data centers may not support larger virtual machine sizes, such as A5 – A11.
trans-unit.target: Some of the physical hosts in Azure data centers may not support larger virtual machine sizes, such as A5 – A11.

trans-unit.source: As a result, you may see the error message **Failed to configure virtual machine <machine name>** or **Failed to create virtual machine <machine name>** when resizing an existing virtual machine to a new size; creating a new virtual machine in a virtual network created before April 16, 2013; or adding a new virtual machine to an existing cloud service.
trans-unit.target: As a result, you may see the error message **Failed to configure virtual machine <machine name>** or **Failed to create virtual machine <machine name>** when resizing an existing virtual machine to a new size; creating a new virtual machine in a virtual network created before April 16, 2013; or adding a new virtual machine to an existing cloud service.

trans-unit.source: See [Error: “Failed to configure virtual machine”](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/9693f56c-fcd3-4d42-850e-5e3b56c7d6be/error-failed-to-configure-virtual-machine-with-a5-a6-or-a7-vm-size?forum=WAVirtualMachinesforWindows) on the support forum for workarounds for each deployment scenario.
trans-unit.target: See [Error: “Failed to configure virtual machine”](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/9693f56c-fcd3-4d42-850e-5e3b56c7d6be/error-failed-to-configure-virtual-machine-with-a5-a6-or-a7-vm-size?forum=WAVirtualMachinesforWindows) on the support forum for workarounds for each deployment scenario.

trans-unit.source: We have created the concept of the Azure Compute Unit (ACU) to provide a way of comparing compute (CPU) performance across Azure SKUs.
trans-unit.target: We have created the concept of the Azure Compute Unit (ACU) to provide a way of comparing compute (CPU) performance across Azure SKUs.

trans-unit.source: This will help you easily identify which SKU is most likely to satisfy your performance needs.
trans-unit.target: This will help you easily identify which SKU is most likely to satisfy your performance needs.

trans-unit.source: ACU is currently standardized on a Small (Standard_A1) VM being 100 and all other SKUs then represent approximately how much faster that SKU can run a standard benchmark.
trans-unit.target: ACU is currently standardized on a Small (Standard_A1) VM being 100 and all other SKUs then represent approximately how much faster that SKU can run a standard benchmark.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The ACU is only a guideline.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The ACU is only a guideline.

trans-unit.source: The results for your workload may vary.
trans-unit.target: The results for your workload may vary.

trans-unit.source: ACUs marked with a * use Intel® Turbo technology to increase CPU frequency and provide a performance boost.
trans-unit.target: ACUs marked with a * use Intel® Turbo technology to increase CPU frequency and provide a performance boost.

trans-unit.source: The amount of the boost can vary based on the VM size, workload, and other workloads running on the same host.
trans-unit.target: The amount of the boost can vary based on the VM size, workload, and other workloads running on the same host.

trans-unit.source: The following tables show the sizes and the capacities they provide.
trans-unit.target: The following tables show the sizes and the capacities they provide.

trans-unit.source: Storage capacity is represented by using 1024^3 bytes as the unit of measurement for GB.
trans-unit.target: Storage capacity is represented by using 1024^3 bytes as the unit of measurement for GB.

trans-unit.source: This is sometimes referred to as gibibyte, or base 2 definition.
trans-unit.target: This is sometimes referred to as gibibyte, or base 2 definition.

trans-unit.source: When comparing sizes that use different base systems, remember that base 2 sizes may appear smaller than base 10 but for any specific size (such as 1 GB) a base 2 system provides more capacity than a base 10 system, because 1024^3 is greater than 1000^3.
trans-unit.target: When comparing sizes that use different base systems, remember that base 2 sizes may appear smaller than base 10 but for any specific size (such as 1 GB) a base 2 system provides more capacity than a base 10 system, because 1024^3 is greater than 1000^3.

trans-unit.source: Maximum network bandwidth is the maximum aggregated bandwidth allocated and assigned per VM type.
trans-unit.target: Maximum network bandwidth is the maximum aggregated bandwidth allocated and assigned per VM type.

trans-unit.source: The maximum bandwidth provides guidance for selecting the right VM type to ensure adequate network capacity is available.
trans-unit.target: The maximum bandwidth provides guidance for selecting the right VM type to ensure adequate network capacity is available.

trans-unit.source: When moving between Low, Moderate, High and Very High, the throughput will increase accordingly.
trans-unit.target: When moving between Low, Moderate, High and Very High, the throughput will increase accordingly.

trans-unit.source: Actual network performance will depend on many factors including network and application loads, and application network settings.
trans-unit.target: Actual network performance will depend on many factors including network and application loads, and application network settings.

trans-unit.source: Note: For information and considerations about using these sizes, see [About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-a8-a9-a10-a11-specs.md).
trans-unit.target: Note: For information and considerations about using these sizes, see [About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-a8-a9-a10-a11-specs.md).

trans-unit.source: *The maximum input/output operations per second (IOPS) and throughput (bandwidth) possible with a DS series VM is affected by the size of the disk.
trans-unit.target: *The maximum input/output operations per second (IOPS) and throughput (bandwidth) possible with a DS series VM is affected by the size of the disk.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../articles/storage/storage-premium-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../articles/storage/storage-premium-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: *The maximum input/output operations per second (IOPS) and throughput (bandwidth) possible with a DS series VM is affected by the size of the disk.
trans-unit.target: *The maximum input/output operations per second (IOPS) and throughput (bandwidth) possible with a DS series VM is affected by the size of the disk.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../articles/storage/storage-premium-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../articles/storage/storage-premium-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: Notes: Standard A0 - A4 using CLI and Powershell
trans-unit.target: Notes: Standard A0 - A4 using CLI and Powershell

trans-unit.target: In the classic deployment model, some VM size names are slightly different in CLI and Powershell:

trans-unit.target: Learn about [azure subscription and service limits, quotas, and constraints](../articles/azure-subscription-service-limits.md).

trans-unit.target: Learn more [about the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-a8-a9-a10-a11-specs.md) for workloads like High-performance Computing (HPC).
